articles.headline: Fed’s Elusive Prescriptions for an Erratic Ailment
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve is back in the spotlight, and whether it is ready to plunge into uncharted waters is in question.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve is back in the spotlight, and whether it is ready to plunge into uncharted waters is in question.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve is back in the spotlight, with investors anxiously wondering if the central bank will end a two-month hiatus and announce new measures to support the economy on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Japan Held Nuclear Data, Leaving Evacuees in Peril
articles.snippet: Residents of a town in the nuclear disaster zone expressed fury that unpublished radiation forecasts could have prevented them from harm.
articles.abstract: Residents of a town in the nuclear disaster zone expressed fury that unpublished radiation forecasts could have prevented them from harm.
articles.lead_paragraph: FUKUSHIMA, Japan — The day after a giant tsunami set off the continuing disaster at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant, thousands of residents at the nearby town of Namie gathered to evacuate.
articles.byline: By Norimitsu Onishi and Martin Fackler

articles.headline: Obama Counsels Calm, but No Deal Is in Sight
articles.snippet: The president said a refusal to put what’s the good of the nation ahead of self-interest or party had to change so a solution could be reached.
articles.abstract: The president said a refusal to put what’s the good of the nation ahead of self-interest or party had to change so a solution could be reached.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If ever there was a time for contrition in this town, it might be after the events of the last few days: a deeply embarrassing downgrading of the nation’s credit rating, poll numbers showing public support for Congress at record lows, topped on Monday with a bracing plunge in the stock market.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Behind S.&P.’s Downgrade, a Committee That Acts in Private
articles.snippet: Despite the great interest in the agency’s decision, it has remained tight-lipped on what happened in their deliberations.
articles.abstract: Despite the great interest in the agency’s decision, it has remained tight-lipped on what happened in their deliberations.
articles.lead_paragraph: A committee of about a half-dozen largely unknown people made a decision last Friday that has roiled Washington and Wall Street.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell, Louise Story and Edward Wyatt

articles.headline: A Wave of Worry Threatens to Build on Itself
articles.snippet: When businesses and households think conditions are too tumultuous for expansion, they pull back, which can make things even worse.
articles.abstract: When businesses and households think conditions are too tumultuous for expansion, they pull back, which can make things even worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: Employers delaying or suspending hiring. Home buyers getting cold feet. Shoppers pulling back on spending.
articles.byline: By Motoko Rich and Nelson D. Schwartz

articles.headline: After Day of Tumult, Dow Closes Up 430 Points
articles.snippet: Stocks fluctuated wildly after an announcement by the Fed, first shedding the day’s gains, then rising sharply as the market headed toward its close.
articles.abstract: Stocks fluctuated wildly after an announcement by the Fed, first shedding the day’s gains, then rising sharply as the market headed toward its close.
articles.lead_paragraph: In another wild day on Wall Street, stocks climbed, then dropped, then rocketed as traders did a double take on the Federal Reserve’s much-awaited statement on the economy Tuesday afternoon.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley and Christine Hauser
